bill_title: require that a noxious weed buyer awareness form be signed by a buyer of certain real property.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that a noxious weed buyer awareness form be signed by a buyer of certain real property. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 43-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Buyer," a person negotiating or attempting to become an owner of real property by means of a transfer that is subject to this Act; (2) "Noxious weed buyer awareness form," the noxious weed buyer awareness form required in this Act; (3) "Seller," an owner of real property who is offering to sell real property or any person or agency that is selling real property for the owner of real property that is subject to this Act; (4) "Transfer," pertaining to real property, a sale, exchange, installment sale contract, lease with an option to purchase, other option to purchase, or a ground lease coupled with improvement. Section 2. That chapter 43-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The seller of any real property of at least one acre but no more than forty acres in size that is located outside the boundaries of an incorporated municipality shall furnish to the buyer at the time of closing of the sale a noxious weed buyer awareness form. The seller shall also provide an identification brochure of state-declared noxious weeds and a brochure or list of locally- declared noxious weeds, if available, to the buyer at the time of the closing of the sale. The buyer shall sign the noxious weed buyer awareness form, and the seller shall send the signed form to the county weed and pest supervisor or, if there is no county supervisor, to the county weed and pest board chairman from the county in which the transferred property is located. The form shall be sent within sixty days of the date on which the property was transferred. The noxious weed buyer awareness form shall, at a minimum, include a statement describing the requirements of this section that apply to buyers and sellers, a listing or brief description of South Dakota statutes that pertain to the duties of property owners with respect to the control of weeds and pests, a line in which the legal description of the transferred property shall be entered, and a line for the signature of the buyer. The South Dakota Weed and Pest Control Commission shall promulgate rules, pursuant to chapter 1-26, to design the noxious weed buyer awareness form and each brochure required by this section. The rules shall specify where the form and brochures are available to the public and how they may be obtained.
